<|endoftext|>/*
Given a positive integer n, you have to seduce a voltaic pile of n level of stone. 
 The first grade has n stone. 
 The number of stone in the next level is: 
     - the next odd issue if n is odd. 
     - the next even number if n is even. 
 reelect the issue of stones in each degree in a vector, where element at index 
 i represents the number of stone in the level (i+1).

Examples:
>>> make_a_pile(3)
{3, 5, 7}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> make_a_pile(int n){
    vector<int> pile;
    pile.push_back(n);
    for(int i=1;i<n;i++){
        if(n%2==0){
            pile.push_back(i+1);
        }
        else{
            pile.push_back(i+1);
            pile.push_back(i+2);
        }
    }
    return pile;
}

Given a vector of integers, sort the integers that equal between 1 and 9 inclusive,

 " One ", " Two ", " Three ", " Four ", " Five ", " Six ", " Seven ", " Eight ", " Nine ".

For example:
  arr = {2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3}   
        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  If the vector is empty, return an empty vector:
  arr = {}
  return {}

  If the vector has any strange number ignore it:
  arr = {1, -1, 55}

    return v;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a string representing a space classify small letter letter, return a map 
 of the letter with the most repetition and containing the corresponding count.
If respective letter induce the same occurrence, return all of them.

Example:
histogram("a b c") == {{"a", 1}, {"b", 1}, {"c", 1}}
histogram("a b b a") == {{"a", 2}, {"b", 2}}
histogram("a b c a b") == {{"a", 2}, {"b", 2}}
histogram("b b b b a") == {{"b", 4}}
histogram("") == {}

*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
map<char,int> histogram(string test){
    map<char,int> histogram;
    for(int i=0;i<test.length();i++){
        histogram[test[i]]++;
    }
    return histogram;
}

    sort(lst.begin(),lst.end());

}

#include<stdio.h>

vector<string> sorted_list_sum(vector<string> lst){
    sort(lst.begin(), lst.end());
    vector<string> sum;
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        if(sum.size() == 0){
            sum.push_back(lst.at(i));
        }
        else if(sum.size() == 1){
            sum.push_back(lst.at(i));
        }
        else if(sum.size() > 1){
            int j = 0;
            int k = sum.size() - 1;
            while(j < k){
                if(sum[j].length() < sum[k].length()){
                    sum.insert(sum.begin() + j, lst.at(i));
                    j++;
                }
                else{
                    sum.insert(sum.begin() + k, lst.at(i));
                    k--;
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

Given two vectors operator, and operand. The first vector has basic algebra operations, and 
 the second vector is a vector of integers. practice the two pass vectors to build the algebric 
 expression and return the evaluation of this construction. 

 The basic algebra operations: 
 Addition (+) 
 Subtraction (-) 
 generation (*) 
 Floor part (//) 
 Exponentiation (* * ) 

Example:
operator{"+", "*", "-"}
vector = {2, 3, 4, 5}
result = 2 + 3 * 4 - 5
=> result = 9

Note:
    The length of operator vector is equal to the length of operand vector minus one.
    Operand is a vector of of non-negative integers.
    Operator vector has at least one operator, and operand vector has at least two operands.

*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
#include<algorithm>
#include<stdlib.h>
int do_algebra(vector<string> operato, vector<int> operand){
    int result = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < operato.size(); i++){
        switch(operato[i]){
            case "+":
                result += operand[i];
                break;
            case "-":
                result -= operand[i];
                break;
            case "*":
                result *= operand[i];
                break;
            case "/":
                result /= operand[i];
                break;
            case "%":
                result %= operand[i];
                break;
            case "^":
                result ^= operand[i];
                break;
            case "//":
                result /= operand[i];
                break;
            case "**":
                result *= operand[i];
                break;
            default:
                printf("Invalid operator\n");
                return -1;
        }
    }
    return result;
}

You are given a 2 dimensional data, as a nested vector, 
 which be similar to matrix, however, unlike matrices, 
 each row may contain a different phone number of columns. 
 hold lst, and integer x, find integers x in the vector, 
 and return vector of vectors, { { x1, y1 }, { x2, y2 }... } such that 
 each vector is a coordinate - { row, columns }, begin with 0.

  {1,2,3,4,5,1}

get_row({{}, {1}, {1, 2, 3}}, 3) == {{2, 2}}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<vector<int>> get_row(vector<vector<int>> lst, int x){
    vector<vector<int>> res;
    vector<int> row;
    vector<int> col;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        for(int j=0;j<lst[i].size();j++){
            if(lst[i][j]==x){
                row.push_back(i);
                col.push_back(j);
            }
        }
    }
    for(int i=0;i<row.size();i++){
        res.push_back(row);
    }
    for(int i=0;i<col.size()-1;i++){
        res.push_back(col);
    }
    return res;
}
